bluetooth-unsupported-advice.value: We recommend Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge so you can connect directly to your micro:bit.

bluetooth-unsupported-explain.value: Unfortunately, WebUSB and Web Bluetooth are not supported by this browser. This means you cannot connect to a micro:bit to record the data samples needed to train a machine learning model.

certainty-tooltip.value: How confident the model is that you are currently doing each action.

code-tooltip.value: These are the MakeCode blocks for each detected action when you transfer your ML model and code to a micro:bit

connect-battery-heading.value: Disconnect USB and connect battery pack

connect-battery-link.value: You can attach the micro:bit to your wrist or an object

connect-battery-subtitle.value: Disconnect the micro:bit from the computer and connect the battery pack.

connect-bluetooth-start-heading.value: What you need to connect using Web Bluetooth

connect-bluetooth-start-requirements2-su.value: with Internet, a USB port & Web Bluetooth

connect-cable-alt.value: animation showing a USB cable being connected to the top of a micro:bit

connect-cable-download-project-subtitle.value: Connect a micro:bit to this computer with a USB cable to download your machine learning MakeCode program to it.

connect-cable-subtitle.value: Connect the micro:bit to this computer with a USB cable so that the data collection program can be downloaded to it.

connect-data-collection-subtitle.value: Connect the first micro:bit to this computer with a USB cable so that the data collection program can be downloaded to it. This is the micro:bit you will use to collect data samples.

connect-failed-bluetooth1.value: The connection to the data collection micro:bit could not be established.

connect-failed-bridge-heading.value: Failed to connect to radio link micro:bit

connect-failed-bridge1.value: The connection to the micro:bit connected to your computer could not be established.

connect-failed-remote-heading.value: Failed to connect to data collection micro:bit

connect-failed-remote1.value: The connection to the data collection micro:bit could not be established.

connect-pattern-input-label.value: Number of LEDs lit in column

connect-pattern-subtitle.value: Copy the pattern displayed on the micro:bit.

connect-popup-bluetooth-alt.value: Web Bluetooth connection dialog with BBC micro:bit entry labelled 1 and Pair button labelled 2

connect-popup-bluetooth-title.value: Connect to micro:bit using Web Bluetooth

connect-popup-usb-bluetooth-data-collect.value: Download data collection program to micro:bit

connect-popup-usb-radio-data-collection-.value: Download data collection program to micro:bit 1

connect-popup-usb-radio-link-title.value: Download radio link program to micro:bit 2

connect-radio-data-collection-microbit-d.value: Connect the data collection micro:bit to this computer to download your machine learning MakeCode program to it. If you're wearing the data collection micro:bit, you may need to remove it.

connect-radio-data-collection-microbit-t.value: Connect USB cable to the data collection micro:bit

connect-radio-link-subtitle.value: Connect a second micro:bit to this computer with a USB cable so that the radio link program can be downloaded to it. This radio link micro:bit will communicate with the data collection micro:bit.

connect-radio-start-heading.value: What you need to connect using micro:bit radio

connect-to-record-body.value: Connect a micro:bit to record a data sample.

connect-to-test-model.value: Connect to test your ML model

connect-to-tour-body.value: You need to connect a data collection micro:bit to view the tour.

connect-troubleshoot.value: Troubleshoot problems with connecting to your micro:bit

data-collection-microbit-label.value: diagram showing data collection micro:bit being connected to a person's wrist

data-samples-tooltip.value: Short collections of movement data lasting 1 second. Your data samples are only stored on your computer, they do not get sent to anyone else.

delete-action-confirm-text.value: Are you sure you want to delete the action "

delete-data-samples-confirm-text.value: Are you sure you want to delete all data samples?

disconnected-warning-bluetooth1.value: The connection to the data collection micro:bit has been lost.

disconnected-warning-bluetooth3.value: is powered on (the red light on the back of the micro:bit should be on)

disconnected-warning-bridge1.value: The connection to the micro:bit connected to your computer has been lost.

disconnected-warning-remote1.value: The connection to the data collection micro:bit has been lost.

download-project-choose-microbit-subtitl.value: Downloading your project on to the same micro:bit will disconnect the micro:bit from the tool. You will need to reconnect the micro:bit if you want to record more data samples.

download-project-choose-microbit-title.value: Which micro:bit do you want to use?

download-project-intro-description.value: Your program includes the machine learning model you created. The model runs on the micro:bit so you can use it without being connected to

download-project-intro-title.value: Download your machine learning MakeCode project

downloading-subtitle.value: Please wait. Downloading program to micro:bit.

estimated-action-tooltip.value: This is the action the model thinks you are currently doing.

fingerprint-max-x-tooltip.value: Maximum point among all x-direction data points

fingerprint-max-y-tooltip.value: Maximum point among all y-direction data points

fingerprint-max-z-tooltip.value: Maximum point among all z-direction data points

fingerprint-min-x-tooltip.value: Minimum point among all x-direction data points

fingerprint-min-y-tooltip.value: Minimum point among all y-direction data points

fingerprint-min-z-tooltip.value: Minimum point among all z-direction data points

fingerprint-peaks-x-tooltip.value: Number of extremes among all x-direction data points

fingerprint-peaks-y-tooltip.value: Number of extremes among all y-direction data points

fingerprint-peaks-z-tooltip.value: Number of extremes among all z-direction data points

fingerprint-rms-x-tooltip.value: Root mean square value for all x-direction data points

fingerprint-rms-y-tooltip.value: Root mean square value for all y-direction data points

fingerprint-rms-z-tooltip.value: Root mean square value for all z-direction data points

fingerprint-std-x-tooltip.value: Average deviation from 0 among all x-direction data points

fingerprint-std-y-tooltip.value: Average deviation from 0 among all y-direction data points

fingerprint-std-z-tooltip.value: Average deviation from 0 among all z-direction data points

fingerprint-zcr-x-tooltip.value: Rate at which acceleration transitions between positive and negative for x-direction data points

fingerprint-zcr-y-tooltip.value: Rate at which acceleration transitions between positive and negative for y-direction data points

fingerprint-zcr-z-tooltip.value: Rate at which acceleration transitions between positive and negative for z-direction data points

firmware-outdated-content1.value: Connecting to the micro:bit failed because the firmware on your micro:bit is too old.

firmware-outdated-content2.value: before you can connect to this micro:bit.

homepage-alt.value: graph showing x, y, z graph lines representing micro:bit accelerometer data

homepage-description.value: Train a machine learning model on your own movement data and run it on your micro:bit.

homepage-how-it-works-paragraph.value: Watch the video to get started. Learn more in the

homepage-subtitle.value: Create AI on your BBC micro:bit using movement and machine learning.

import-error-dialog-content.value: Only MakeCode hex files or data samples files (.json) can be opened by

incompatible-device-body-alt.value: Go back to select a different micro:bit, or
which can be downloaded onto a micro:bit V2 later.

incompatible-device-body1.value: Continue to MakeCode to edit the program. You can then save the project hex which can be downloaded onto a micro:bit V2.

incompatible-device-subtitle.value: You are using a micro:bit V1, but machine learning projects need the faster processor on a micro:bit V2.

insufficient-data-body.value: You need at least 3 data samples for 2 actions to train the model.

live-graph-tooltip.value: This graph shows movement data from the micro:bit's accelerometer in real time. Try moving your data collection micro:bit to see the X, Y and Z axes change. Each coloured line represents a different direction (dimension) you are moving the micro:bit in.

makecode-back-alt.value: Left arrow icon for MakeCode back

name-action-hint.value: Name an action you want the micro:bit to recognise

name-used-when.value: The name is used when you save a file.

new-session-setup-description.value: Starting a new session will overwrite your existing session. You may want to

newpage-continue-session-subtitle.value: Use a hex file or data samples file you saved to your computer to continue a session.

newpage-new-session-subtitle.value: Connect your micro:bit and collect movement data to build a machine learning model.

newpage-section-one-title.value: Pick up where you left off

not-create-ai-hex-import-dialog-content.value: This project did not contain any data samples, so only the code has been opened. You need to train a model before you can use the code.

not-create-ai-hex-import-dialog-title.value: Your MakeCode project has been imported

other-tabs-body1.value: Another process is connected to this device.

other-tabs-body2.value: Close any other tabs that may be using WebUSB (e.g. MakeCode, Python Editor,
), or unplug and replug the micro:bit before trying again.

project-name-not-empty.value: The project name cannot be empty

radio-link-microbit-label.value: diagram showing radio link micro:bit being connected with a computer

reconnect-failed-bluetooth-heading.value: Failed to reconnect to data collection micro:bit

reconnect-failed-bluetooth1.value: The connection to the data collection micro:bit could not be re-established.

reconnect-failed-bridge-heading.value: Failed to reconnect to radio link micro:bit

reconnect-failed-bridge1.value: The connection to the micro:bit connected to your computer could not be re-established.

reconnect-failed-remote-heading.value: Failed to reconnect to data collection micro:bit

reconnect-failed-remote1.value: The connection to the data collection micro:bit could not be re-established.

reconnect-failed-subtitle.value: Follow these instructions to restart the connection process.

record-hint.value: Press to record a data sample or press button B on your data collection micro:bit.

record-samples-help.value: Each sample has its own countdown

recording-fingerprint-label.value: heatmap showing micro:bit x, y, z accelerometer data features for one recording

recording-graph-label.value: graph showing micro:bit x, y, z accelerometer data for one recording

save-hex-dialog-heading.value: Save project as a hex file

save-hex-dialog-message1.value: The download contains your actions, data samples and your MakeCode project. Open it in

save-hex-dialog-message2.value: You can also open it with Microsoft MakeCode if you don't need to change the actions and data samples.

saving-description.value: Your download will be ready soon.

saving-toast-title.value: Your hex file has been downloaded

steps-alt.value: diagram showing the iterative process of collecting data, training a model, testing the model, and improving the model by improving the data collected before finally coding using the model.

tour-collect-addActions-content.value: Decide what your other actions will be and what you will name them. You need at least 2 actions with 3 data samples to train the model. Your data samples are only stored on your computer, they do not get sent to anyone else.

tour-collect-afterFirst-content.value: To train the machine learning model you need at least 3 data samples for 2 different actions.

tour-collect-collectMore-explanation-con.value: Collecting more samples should result in a better machine learning model.

tour-collect-collectMore-hasRecordings-c.value: Record data samples for your actions.

tour-collect-collectMore-noRecordings-co.value: Record more samples for this action.

tour-collect-trainModel-content.value: When you have collected enough data samples you can train the machine learning model. You can come back later to remove or add more data and re-train to make the model more reliable.

tour-dataSamples-actions-common-content.value: An action is the type of movement you want the machine learning model to recognise e.g. ‘waving’ or ‘clapping’.

tour-dataSamples-actions-noRecordings-co.value: Decide what your first action will be, name it and then start recording data samples.

tour-dataSamples-connected-content.value: Now you can start collecting data samples to train a machine learning (ML) model to recognise different movements, or actions.

tour-dataSamples-connected-title.value: Your data collection micro:bit is connected!

tour-dataSamples-liveGraph-content.value: The graph shows movement data from the micro:bit’s accelerometer. Move your data collection micro:bit and see how the graph changes.

tour-makecode-intro-content1.value: Download the model and code to test your project on a micro:bit. You can also add more code blocks to create your own programs using your model.

tour-makecode-intro-content2.value: Need to improve the ML model?

tour-makecode-intro-content3.value: Use this back button in the top left.

tour-trainModel-afterTrain-content.value: Now test your machine learning model. Try each action by moving your data collection micro:bit. Does the model correctly estimate each action?

tour-trainModel-certaintyRecognition-con.value: The bar graph shows how confident the model is that you are doing each action. Move the slider to adjust the recognition point, or threshold.

tour-trainModel-editInMakeCode-content.value: Open your project in MakeCode to download the program and your machine learning model to a micro:bit. You can add more blocks to create your own programs using your model.

tour-trainModel-estimatedAction-content.value: The action the model estimates you are currently doing is shown below the micro:bit icon for that action.

tour-trainModel-makeCodeBlocks-content.value: These MakeCode blocks will show icons for each action detected when you transfer your code and model to a micro:bit.

train-description.value: The computer program spots patterns or differences in your data samples, and uses these to build a mathematical model that allows
to recognise different actions when you move your micro:bit.

train-error-body.value: The training did not result in a usable model. The reason for this is most likely the data used for training. If the data samples for different actions are too similar, this can result in issues in the training process.

train-error-todo.value: Return to the Add data page and change your data.

transfer-hex-alt.value: animation of dragging a hex file from the downloads folder onto the micro:bit drive or device listed in the file explorer

transfer-hex-heading.value: Transfer saved hex file to micro:bit

transfer-hex-manual-download.value: If the file did not automatically download then

transfer-hex-message.value: Drag the hex file from your Downloads folder to the MICROBIT drive.

unplug-radio-link-microbit-description.value: Unplug the radio link micro:bit from the computer. You will need to reconnect the micro:bit if you want to record more data samples.

unplug-radio-link-microbit-label.value: animation showing a USB cable being disconnected from the top of a micro:bit

unsupported-device-explain.value: Unfortunately, we only support using micro:bit V2 when connecting using micro:bit radio. You have connected a

unsupported-device-header.value: micro:bit radio connections do not support micro:bit V1

unsupported-device-with-bluetooth.value: Please use Web Bluetooth to connect to your micro:bit V1 instead.

unsupported-device-without-bluetooth.value: You can connect to micro:bit V1 using Web Bluetooth, however, this browser or device does not have Bluetooth enabled.

webusb-retry-no-select.value: You didn't select a micro:bit. Do you want to try again?

webusb-retry-replug3.value: check that this micro:bit does not have a battery pack connected

webusb-retry-replug4.value: unplug and replug the USB cable
